definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Analysis about some phenomenon of using characters of bronze inscriptions in the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 分析讨论汉代金文中的用字研究。

sentences.english: Sometimes you just need to improve the wording of an error message.
sentences.chinese: 有时候只要改良某个错误讯息的用字。

sentences.english: The teacher crossed out several incorrect words in Tanya , s composition.
sentences.chinese: 老师将坦雅作文里几个用字不当的地方划线删除。

sentences.english: To direct representations of words, accurate, can be Baimiao modification, real deep.
sentences.chinese: 要直接陈述，用字准确，可白描修饰，真切深刻。

sentences.english: But conjecture carefully, the ancient use chinese characters more precise.
sentences.chinese: 但是仔细揣摩，还是古人用字更确切。

sentences.english: Such problematic yet common words are among the first a child has to learn.
sentences.chinese: 这些可都是日常用字，是孩子一开始就得学会的。

sentences.english: Watch your language or you'll be spending the weekend in your room.
sentences.chinese: 注意你的用字，否则你这个周末将禁足在家。

sentences.english: I had corrected some vocabularies cause that made many people misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 会有人会错意，所以我重新修改用字遣词。

sentences.english: The effectiveness of your speech depends on your diction.
sentences.chinese: 你的演说效果在于你的用字是否得当。

sentences.english: If you read it in words, it becomes a fact.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用字来读，那它就会变成事实。

sentences.english: The words in this book vary from the earlier version.
sentences.chinese: 这本书的用字跟早期的版本有差异。

sentences.english: I crossed the last line out of my letter because it had the wrong tone to it .
sentences.chinese: 老师将坦雅作文里几个用字不当的地方划线删除。

sentences.english: The origianal and interchangeable characters were quite different from the loan characters.
sentences.chinese: 同源通用与同音借用是两种不同的用字现象。

definition: single Chinese character/word (in a foreign language)
level and oblique tones (technical term for Classical Chinese rhythmic poetry)
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
